comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Ardent Socialist and social reformer; author of the shocking bestseller, "The Jungle," (1906) a novel that exposed deplorable conditions in the meatpacking industry in Chicago. In 1914, the date of this photo, the movie version of "The Jungle" was released. Sinclair himself appeared at the beginning and end of the film.

Born in Baltimore, Sinclair as a child moved with his family to New York City, and grew up there.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thank you victuallers2 and Wystan for the information on Upton Sinclair.  We will add some of it to the image description when we update.

comment._content: The LOC, no. But some of the eager denizens of Flickrland who enjoy these wonderful old photos may not share your background of knowledge and erudition.
